frameDefinitions: A Speaker uses language to affirm or deny the truth of a Message to some Addressee.
An Inspector attains a degree of certainty in the Unconfirmed_content, generally by inspecting some evidence.
An Arguer presents a Content, along with Support, to an Addressee.
These adjectives describe the degree of strictness or tolerance of an Agent, usually with regard to another person (the Controllee) and often with regard to a particular Issue.
A Proposition is attributed to a Speaker or a Text.
The Support, a phenomenon or fact,  lends support to a claim or proposed course of action, the Proposition, where the Domain_of_relevance may also be expressed.
frameExamples: She <t>affirmed</t> her loyalty to the cause.
Jan <t>argued</t> that the evidence was inadmissable.
Court says judge too <t>lenient</t> in rape case.INI

<t>According</t> <t>to</t> the Press Trust of India in an article published on its Web site Thursday, the woman has been identified as 31-year-old Aafia Siddiqui, who was being sought by U.S. officials last week along with two other men, including one whose last known address was in Miramar, Fla.
The latest poll results <t>show</t> that support of the president is at an all-time low.
listRoleDefinitions: The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity affirming or denying the truth of the <fen>Message</fen> (this can be spoken or written). It is normally expressed as the External Argument of the predicative uses of the target word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> identifies the content whose truth the <fen>Speaker</fen> is affirming or denying. It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the <fen>Message</fen>.

The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is rarely mentioned in constructions with verbal targets, and is much more common with nominal targets, where it is usually expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'of' or about'.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
<fen>Place</fen> specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> is affirmed or denied.
The individual or individuals that ascertain that the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen> is true.
An open proposition that the <fen>Inspector</fen> decides by examining evidence.  It is usually a propostion put forward which some parties would disbelieve or contest.
The <fen>Medium</fen> is the piece of text or work in which the <fen>Inspector</fen> verifies the <fen>Unconfirmed_content</fen>:
This role describes the <fen>Time</fen> at which the verification event takes place.
This role describes where the verificiation event takes place.

The <fen>Arguer</fen> wants the <fen>Addressee</fen> to entertain the <fen>Content</fen>, which can be a proposition to be believed or a course of action to be taken, based on the <fen>Support</fen> presented.
The <fen>Arguer</fen> presents the <fen>Content</fen> before the <fen>Addressee</fen>.
The Time at which an <fen>Arguer</fen> makes an argument for the <fen>Content</fen>.
This role identifies the location where an argument is made by an <fen>Arguer</fen>.

The Agent is the person who is strict or liberal in his/her control over another. This role is usually the External Argument with predicate adjectives, or the head noun if the adjective is used attributively: <fex name='Agent'>The school</fex> is very <t>liberal</t> in approach and curriculum. I attended a very <t>liberal</t> <fex name='Agent'>school</fex>.

The Agent's strictness may be directed towards or limited to some particular person or group over whom he/she has control.  The Controlled_entity generally occurs in a PP Complement.
Grandparents are often <t>indulgent</t> <fex name='Controlled_entity'>with their grandchildren</fex>.
The Agent's strictness may be manifested in particular behavior: The judge was <t>lenient</t> <fex name='Controlling_act'>in dealing with the offender</fex>.

The Agent may be strict or lenient with respect to a particular matter or situation.  Issue occurs in PP Complements, usually headed by <ment>about</ment>: The city council is <t>strict</t> <fex name='Issue'>about pollution control</fex>.

A Medium of control, such as rules, may also be described as strict or lenient.  Medium may occur with or without the Agent who ultimately has control (i.e. the one who implements or enforces the rules). The club has <t>strict</t> <fex name='Medium'>rules</fex> about who can become a member. <fex name='Medium'>Immigration law</fex> is very <t>strict</t>.
The body part or expression of the <fen>Agent</fen> that indicates their strictness.
The information attributed to the <fen>Speaker</fen> or <fen>Text</fen>.
A sentient entity that has communicated the information encoded by the <fen>Proposition</fen>.
A written or verbal collection of statements, which imparts the information of the <fen>Proposition</fen>.
Support is a fact that lends epistemic support to a claim, or that provides a reason for a course of action. Typically it is expressed as an External Argument.
This is a belief, claim, or proposed course of action to which the Support lends validity. Normally it is expressed as a Finite Clause Complement:
listRoleExamples: No one believed <fex>Evelyn</fex>'s affirmation that she could speak to ghosts.
They refute the criticisms <fex>that they are only interested in power and money</fex>.
<fex>His</fex> later verification of the facts is certainly beyond reproach.
It is extremely difficult to confirm <fex>the absence of something</fex>.
<fex>Chapter four</fex> confirms the reader 's suspicions completely.
Jan argued <fex>that the evidence was inadmissable</fex>.
<fex>Jan</fex> argued that the evidence was inadmissable.
The government argued <fex>in August</fex> that the prisoners should not be released
The young men will be arguing their policies <fex>in the school auditorium</fex>.
I like to think he quaked under my authoritarian <fex>glare</fex>.
<fex>Parents are present at and involved in the purchase or rental of games 83 percent of the time</fex>, according to a September 2000 Federal Trade Commission report

With the first big batch of music now blocked from Napster's file-swapping network, the average number of songs available on the service has dropped precipitously, according to <fex>at least one research company</fex>.
The son of the Syrian defense minister received 6 million barrels, according to <fex>the document</fex>, worth about $3 million.
<fex>The fact that you lied to me</fex> shows that I shouldn't trust you.
The fact that you lied to me shows <fex>that I shouldn't trust you</fex>.

passageCandidateSpans.text: Climategate and the Corruption of Science
